citation.article-title: Reclassification of the genus Pasteurella Trevisan 1887 on the basis of deoxyribonucleic acid homology, with proposals for the new species Pasteurella dagmatis, Pasteurella canis, Pasteurella stomatis, Pasteurella anatis, and Pasteurella langaa.

p.s: Description of Pasteurella anatis sp. nov.
Pasteurella anatis (a.na'tis L.fem.gen.n. anatis of a duck)
They do not decarboxylate ornithine, do not produce indole, and do not hydrolyze urea.
No acid is produced from L-arabinose, maltose, D-lactose, raffinose, sorbitol, or dulcitol; acid is produced from trehalose, D-xylose, and mannitol.
Members of this species have been isolated from the intestinal tracts of ducks.
The G+C content is 39.9 to 42.3 mol% (Tm method).
The genome molecular weights range from 1.8 x 109 to 1.9 x 109.
The type strain of P. anatis is strain NCTC 11413.
